items.headline: Curry Sidelined! Warriors Star Stephen Curry Out of 2026 All-Star Game with Lingering Knee Injury
items.summary: Golden State Warriors superstar Stephen Curry has been officially ruled out of the upcoming 2026 NBA All-Star Game due to a troublesome right knee injury that has kept him out of several recent games. Head Coach Steve Kerr confirmed the news, stating Curry will also miss Wednesday's game against the Spurs in hopes of returning after the All-Star break.

items.headline: Warriors' Jimmy Butler Undergoes Successful ACL Surgery, Out for Season
items.summary: In a major blow for the Golden State Warriors, star forward Jimmy Butler underwent successful surgery on his torn right ACL on Monday morning in Los Angeles. He is expected to miss the remainder of the 2025-26 season and will likely not return until the middle of the 2026-27 campaign.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Returns with a Bang for Blazers!
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija made a triumphant return to the lineup after missing a week due to a back injury, posting an impressive 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists in a dominant win over the 76ers. Avdija's return provided a crucial spark as the Blazers continue their postseason push.

items.headline: NBA Trade Deadline Delivers Blockbuster Deals: Harden to CLE, AD to WAS!
items.summary: The NBA trade deadline saw significant movement, with several star players changing teams. James Harden was traded to the Cleveland Cavaliers, Anthony Davis landed with the Washington Wizards, and Jaren Jackson Jr. headed to the Utah Jazz. Other notable moves included Coby White to the Hornets and Ivica Zubac to the Pacers, reshaping the league's landscape heading into the All-Star break.

items.headline: Pistons Edge Hornets in Close Contest
Nets Outpace Bulls
items.summary: The Brooklyn Nets defeated the Chicago Bulls 123-115.

items.headline: Mitchell, Harden Lead Cavs Past Nuggets
items.summary: Donovan Mitchell scored 32 points and James Harden added 22 points in his second game with the Cavaliers to rally Cleveland over Denver. Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double for the Nuggets.

items.headline: Warriors Stun Grizzlies in Tight Matchup
Blazers Rout 76ers Behind Camara's Career Night
items.summary: Toumani Camara exploded for a career-high 30 points and Deni Avdija added 26 points and 10 rebounds as the Trail Blazers dominated the 76ers. Philadelphia played without Joel Embiid.

items.headline: Thunder Top Lakers with Williams' Return
items.summary: Jalen Williams scored 23 points in his return from injury, leading the Thunder past the Lakers, who were without Luka Doncic.

items.headline: Knicks Get Revenge on Celtics
items.summary: Jalen Brunson's 31 points led the Knicks to a dominant victory over the Celtics.

items.headline: Heat Cruise Past Wizards
items.summary: Bam Adebayo scored 22 points, grabbed 8 rebounds, and had 5 steals as the Heat easily defeated the Wizards.

items.headline: Raptors Down Pacers
items.summary: Scottie Barnes had a double-double with 25 points and 14 rebounds to lead the Raptors to victory.

items.headline: Clippers Beat Timberwolves
items.summary: Kawhi Leonard exploded for 41 points as the Clippers secured a win over the Timberwolves.

items.headline: Deni Avdija's Strong Return
items.summary: In his first game back from injury, Israeli forward Deni Avdija showcased his all-around game with 26 points, 10 rebounds, and 8 assists to power the Blazers.

items.headline: Toumani Camara's Career Night
items.summary: Trail Blazers forward Toumani Camara erupted for a career-high 30 points, sinking 8 three-pointers, in Portland's victory over the 76ers.

items.headline: Donovan Mitchell Leads Cavaliers
items.summary: Donovan Mitchell was electric for the Cavaliers, dropping 32 points and dishing out 10 assists in their narrow win against the Nuggets.

items.headline: Nikola Jokic's Triple-Double
items.summary: Nuggets center Nikola Jokic continued his dominant season with another triple-double, tallying 22 points, 14 rebounds, and 11 assists against the Cavaliers.

items.headline: Kawhi Leonard's Scoring Explosion
items.summary: Kawhi Leonard put on a scoring clinic for the Clippers, dropping a massive 41 points in their victory over the Timberwolves.

items.headline: Jalen Brunson Fuels Knicks Offense
items.summary: Jalen Brunson led the New York Knicks with 31 points and 8 assists in their decisive win against the Boston Celtics.

items.headline: Anthony Edwards Dominates for Wolves
items.summary: Anthony Edwards scored 30 points to lead the Minnesota Timberwolves to a comfortable win over the Atlanta Hawks.

items.headline: Julius Randle Achieves Triple-Double
items.summary: Timberwolves forward Julius Randle recorded a triple-double with 18 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists in their win against the Hawks.

items.headline: Scottie Barnes' All-Around Game
items.summary: Scottie Barnes delivered a strong double-double for the Raptors, posting 25 points, 14 rebounds, and 6 assists against the Pacers.

items.headline: Tyrese Maxey's Scoring Effort
items.summary: Tyrese Maxey led the Philadelphia 76ers with 30 points in their game against the Portland Trail Blazers.

items.headline: Stephen Curry's Knee Injury to Keep Him Out Through All-Star Break
items.summary: The Golden State Warriors announced that Stephen Curry will not only miss the 2026 All-Star Game but also their upcoming game against the Spurs as he continues to recover from a right knee injury, described as right patellofemoral pain syndrome. His return is hoped for after the All-Star break.

items.headline: Key Injuries Affecting Star Players
items.summary: Several star players are dealing with significant injuries. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (OKC) is out through the All-Star Game with an abdominal injury, while Luka Doncic (LAL) missed his second consecutive game due to a mild hamstring strain. Additionally, Joel Embiid (PHI) was rested last night due to knee soreness.

items.headline: NBA Trade Deadline Recap: Stars on the Move and Remaining Stalwarts
items.summary: The 2026 NBA trade deadline has concluded with a flurry of significant moves. James Harden is now a Cavalier, Anthony Davis joins the Wizards, and Jaren Jackson Jr. is with the Jazz. Despite earlier rumors, Giannis Antetokounmpo (MIL) and Ja Morant (MEM) ultimately remained with their respective teams.

items.headline: Today's NBA Slate: Four Exciting Matchups!
items.summary: Four games are on the schedule for today, February 10, 2026. Catch the Indiana Pacers at the New York Knicks (7:30 PM EST), the LA Clippers visiting the Houston Rockets (8:00 PM ET), the Dallas Mavericks taking on the Phoenix Suns (9:00 PM ET), and the San Antonio Spurs clashing with the Los Angeles Lakers (10:30 PM ET).
